poem:
Divorces in Error

click—  
the heart's petitions  
assumed the machine's cold command—  
unjoined, before their time,  
like fruit too soon plucked  
from branches—  
79 slips,  
sown in rushing code—  
where love turned by  
numbers,  
humans stood still  
yet undone by a day's  
swift error—  
year to year,  
day to day—  
a pause misplaced.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Divorce applications wrongly approved after computer error, high court hears Dozens of divorce applications were wrongly approved due to a computer error, the high court has heard. A hearing in London on Wednesday was told that 79 divorces were incorrectly approved after the applications were submitted a day before the law allows. An online system failed to detect that the submissions came a year after marriage, when the law only permits divorces from a year". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Divorce applications wrongly approved after computer error, high court hears Dozens of divorce applications were wrongly approved due to a computer error, the high court has heard. A hearing in London on Wednesday was told that 79 divorces were incorrectly approved after the applications were submitted a day before the law allows. An online system failed to detect that the submissions came a year after marriage, when the law only permits divorces from a year
